topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5570448d6368724f19db0c00#post_5570448d6368724f19db0c00
[bq="HJSDGCE"]I would like to ask.
Why is it that everyone wants to kill, capture, subdue, control, dispose or remake the Hulk?

Why can't they just leave him alone?[/bq]
He's a valuable weapon and a DANGEROUS adversary. The Hulk can yield more damage than a thermonuclear bomb. But without anyone of the nuclear fallout. If someone managed to take control of Hulk (and it HAS happened) they would have a creature no weapon on the planet could stop. Hell that's why Wolverine was initially sent to kill Hulk. Because his adamantium claws can cut through Hulk's bulletproof skin. It's also why the Illuminati sent him to another planet during Civil War.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557069136368723c5d800200#post_557069136368723c5d800200
The Avengers part was by far the best.
But then, everyone began to treat him like trash and a weapon. Fuck, this is why I hated Tony.
He's the personified version of the sentence, "Men of peace make weapons of war."

Hulk would've been OK if he were to be left alone somewhere.

topics.body:
"@MoogSourceVermona":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55706a9a6368722e8b803b00#post_55706a9a6368722e8b803b00
It's not the Illuminati you're thinking of. The Illuminati in the Marvel comics is a group comprised of Tony Stark, Doctor Stephen Strange, Professor Charles Xavier, Reed Richards, Black Bolt, and Namor.

And thene there's the whole deal with Banner. Technically Hulk is TWO people. Why the ever-living fuck would you send the Earth's foremost expert on gamma radiation TO ANOTHER PLANET?! Bruce Banner knows more about Gamma than both Tony Stark and Reed Richards COMBINED.
